title: Red Snapper Ceviche With Jalapeno And Red Onion
summary: Red Snapper Ceviche With Jalapeno And Red Onion is a pescatarian main course. For $22.78 per serving, this recipe covers 58% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One serving contains 1530 calories, 262g of protein, and 19g of fat. This recipe serves 1. 7 people were impressed by this recipe. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 6 hours and 10 minutes. This recipe is typical of South American cuisine. A mixture of bell pepper, lime juice, onion, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so tasty. To use up the lime juice you could follow this main course with the Lime Angel Food Cake with Lime Glaze and Pistachios as a dessert. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 87%. This score is awesome. Similar recipes include Red Snapper, Shrimp, and Watermelon Ceviche, Roasted Cod With Tomatoes and Red Onion, and Pickled Red Onions.

winePairing.pairingText: Fish works really well with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Grüner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. One wine you could try is St. Michael-Eppan Anger Pinot Grigio. It has 4.3 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 23 dollars.

productMatches.title: St. Michael-Eppan Anger Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Depending on the soil and microclimate, Pinot gris varies from a simple everyday wine all the way up to absolute top growths. The warm, sun-exposed vineyards of the Anger sites, with their loamy limestone gravel soils, are a textbook example. The Anger Alto Adige Pinot Grigio has a noble structure, nice balance and fine acidity – making it an absolute pleasure to drink. The strong white goes well with fish and fish soup, guinea fowl breast or veal fillet.
